title: Mozambique supports returning migrants
text: Mozambique has contacted and delivered key information to returning migrants in order to stop the spread of COVID-19. The government has proactively provided testing and phone-screening for migrants and the families of migrants.

title: Tunisia extends visas and offers aid to migrants
text: Tunisia has extended visas, granted financial and in-kind aid, and asked landlords to postone rent payments for foreigners residing in Tunisia.
stats-comment:
Tunisia employees at least 60,000 seasonal migrant workers (Brookings, 2019)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Tunisia labour union advocates for migrants
text: The Tunisian General Labor Union (UGGT), along with MPs and other public figures, has urged the government to allow migrants and refugees access to healthcare. The group has also been supporting migrant workers by collecting and distributing donations.
stats-comment:
Tunisia employees at least 60,000 seasonal migrant workers (Brookings, 2019)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Australia lifts working restrictions for international nursing students
text: In Australia, 20,000 student nurses have had restrictions on their working hours lifted in a bid to help the crisis in aged care caused by COVID-19.
stats-comment: of nurses in Australia are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Australia extends visas for seasonal workers
text: Australia has extended the visas of workers on their Seasonal Worker Programme and Pacific Labour Scheme to ensure that the agricultural sector will ‘get the labour force it needs’.
quote-text: ‘This is a common sense change to support employers, seasonal workers, and our agricultural sector during the many challenges we are facing across the economy due to the COVID-19 pandemic’.
quote-author: Minister for Employment Senator Michaelia Cash
source: Department of Education, Skills and Employment (Australia)

title: Bahrain announces temporary amnesty for irregular migrants
text: Bahrain has promised irregular migrants the ability to regularise their residency status until the end of 2020 without being fined.
stats-comment: of Bahrain's population are foreign citizens (GLMM, 2015)

title: China sends doctors and medical supplies to Italy
text: China has sent 300 intensive-care doctors, COVID-19 test kits, and protective equipment to Italy, responding to an Italian plea for masks in March. China has also sent aid to Spain, Poland, Greece, and the Balkans in a show of ‘coronavirus diplomacy’.

title: Kuwait offers amnesty to undocumented workers
text: Kuwait offered amnesty to undocumented workers in the country. Workers are entitled to free airfare, food, and accommodation during a fine-free repatriation and will be eligible to re-enter the Gulf through legal channels in the future.
stats-comment: of Kuwait’s workforce is foreign-born (GLMM, 2012)

title: New Zealand classifies seasonal agricultural employees as ‘essential workers’
text: New Zealand has classified seasonal agricultural employees as essential workers during the COVID-19 pandemic. All recognised seasonal employees have had their visas renewed for a further three months.
stats-comment:
11,078 seasonal workers arrived in New Zealand in 2018 (New Zealand Immigration)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Qatar commits to paying salaries for migrant workers affected by COVID-19
text: In Qatar quarantined migrant workers, or those undergoing treatment for Covid-19, are receiving full salaries. The Ministry for Social Affairs said all companies must comply with the ruling. Anyone unable to return home has been given assurances of medical treatment, food, and lodging.
stats-comment: of workers in Qatar are migrants (Migrant Policy, 2013)

title: South Korea extends visas and halts deportations
text: The South Korean government has extended visas for workers by 50 days, providing they reached the country under the Employment Permit System. Nearly 18,500 migrants are benefiting from the decision and have retained the right to residency.

title: Vietnam explores relaxing entry for high-skilled migrants
text: Vietnamese government officials have proposed lifting a ban on over 8,400 highly-skilled migrant workers, arguing that it had been ‘difficult to find replacements for them’ internally.

title: Wanning, China supports unemployed migrant workers
text: In Wanning, the Chinese government has created temporary roles for migrants to ensure rural poverty reduction targets are met. Public sector jobs including disinfecting and guarding have been created, with transport, health checks, and food provided.

title: Albania sends doctors and nurses to Italy
text: Albania has sent 30 doctors and nurses to Italy’s Lombardy region to assist the response to COVID-19. Lombardy is the worst-hit Italian region in the crisis.
quote-text: ‘Today we are all Italian. And Italy will win this battle’.
quote-author: Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama, accompanying the Albanian medical team to the airport

title: Belgium allows asylum seekers to work
text: Belgium has allowed people who have applied for asylum to work throughout their application process and any appeal.
stats-comment: Almost 28,000 people submitted an application for asylum in Belgium in 2019 (CGRA)
url: Moratoire sur les faillites d'entreprises, défiscalisation des heures sup'... voici les mesures prises par le "kern élargi" (RTBF)

title: Village near Rome supported by migrant cooperative
text: In Campagnano di Roma, a cooperative of young African migrants called Barikama are growing, packing, and delivering boxes of fresh food to the local community during the COVID-19 outbreak.
quote-text: ‘It’s a beautiful thing that we are helping feed the community in these terrible times’.

title: IOM calls for inclusive, shared approaches for protecting migrants
text: The International Organization for Migration has urged all states to uphold their obligation to assist anyone crossing the Mediterranean during the COVID-19 crisis.
quote-text: ‘The crisis should strengthen our collective resolve to preserve life, protect rights and find common, adaptable solutions to the challenges that affect us all.’

title: Calls for EU member states to include refugee health workers in national COVID-19 responses
text: The Council of Europe and UNHCR are calling for governments to include refugee health professionals in national responses and are recommending the use of the European Qualifications Passport for Refugees.
quote-text: ‘Refugees are ready to ‘show their solidarity and give back to the communities sheltering them’.
quote-author: UN High Commissioner for Refugees Filippo Grandi
stats-comment: of key workers in the EU are migrants (Joint Research Centre, 2020)

title: France allows refugees with non-EU medical certifications to practice
text: France has allowed refugees with non-EU medical qualifications to practice during the COVID-19 response. Refugees whose diplomas have not yet been recognised can practice as an associate, under the responsibility of another doctor.
stats-comment: of French doctors are foreign-trained (Eurostat, 2018)
url: Mobilisation citoyenne : les réfugiés diplômés hors UE peuvent contribuer au service public de santé (Government of France)

title: Germany explores putting asylum seekers to work in agriculture
text: Germany has explored relaxing employment bans for asylum seekers as a means to fill agricultural shortages. MPs supporting the measure cite government data showing almost 160,000 refugees ready and willing to work.
stats-comment: applied for asylum in Germany in 2018 (OECD, 2016)

title: Ireland calls for retired doctors living abroad to return
text: On St Patrick’s Day, Ireland launched a call for retired doctors living abroad to return to aid the COVID-19 response. The country’s ‘Be on call for Ireland’ campaign has received more than 70,000 responses.
quote-text: ‘Your country needs you’.
stats-comment: of doctors in Ireland are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Ireland aiming to allow  refugees and asylum seekers to register as doctors
text: The Irish Medical Council has suggested that refugees could provide ‘essential support; to its health service during the COVID-19 crisis and argued that registering foreign nationals was the current priority’.

title: Ireland offers financial and healthcare support for migrants
text: Ireland has moved to provide COVID-related healthcare to all, regardless of immigration status, including testing for COVID-19. The Pandemic Unemployment Payment provides financial assistance for all workers in Ireland, including regular and irregular migrants.
stats-comment: of key workers in Ireland are migrants (Joint Research Centre, 2020)

title: Italy supports childcare for ‘essential workers’
text: Italy is offering babysitting vouchers for families with parents in essential work. The subsidy of up to 600 euros is available to working asylum seekers and refugees and can be redeemed on care for children under the age of 12.
stats-comment: applied for asylum in Italy in 2018 (Asylum in Europe)

title: Lithuania suspends deportations
text: Lithuania has suspended deportations of foreigners with expired leave to stay during quarantine. The country has also released migrants from administrative liability for illegal stay.
source: Ministry of the Interior of the Republic of Lithuania

title: Norway sends healthcare staff to Italy
text: Norway has sent a team of 25 doctors, nurses, and logistical staff, to aid Italy’s COVID-19 response. The team is based in Lombardy, Italy’s worst-hit region.
quote-text: ‘Solidarity in Europe is not a theoretical exercise… We must help each other when a crisis hits’.

title: Portuguese town creates quarantine housing for migrant agricultural workers
text: Odemira, a municipality in Portugal with a large number of migrant agricultural workers, has set up housing for migrant workers. Large buildings such as sports halls and pavilions have been adapted to accommodate up to 500 workers in order to prevent COVID-19 transmission.
stats-comment: More than 60% of farm workers in Odemira are foreign-born (NY Times, 2014)

title: Poland relaxes visa renewal requirements
text: Poland has relaxed visa renewal requirements for foreigners during COVID-19. Under new legislation, foreigners are not required to submit any applications to extend their stay, with permits renewed automatically.

title: Portugal regularises all migrants and asylum seekers
text: Portugal has regularised all migrants and asylum seekers, following a government announcement that all immigrants with pending residence permit applications have been regularised.
quote-text: ‘Ensuring the access of migrant citizens to health, social security, and job and housing stability is a duty of a solidary society in times of crisis’.
quote-author: Minister of Internal Administration Eduardo Cabrita

title: German region calls for foreign doctors
text: The Saxony State Medical Association has published a call on Facebook for German-speaking foreign-qualified doctors who do not yet have licenses. Saxony is known as the heartland of the far-right nationalist Alternative for Germany (AfD) party.
quote-text: ‘I am waiting for their call’.
quote-author: Syrian-migrant ENT (ear, nose, throat) doctor Shadi Shahda in Saxony

title: French region recruits refugees as seasonal workers
text: Seine-et-Marne has recruited refugees to fill gaps created by a halt in seasonal worker migration due to COVID-19. Refugees from local migrant and asylum shelters have been recruited to pick ripe strawberries and asparagus, and plant produce to harvest later in the year.
stats-comment: France currently lacks 200,000 agricultural workers due to COVID-19 (Financial Times, 2020)

title: Spain recruits migrant doctors and health workers
text: The Spanish government has hired nearly 200 migrant health professionals living in Spain to join the national health system (SNS) to help combat COVID-19.
stats-comment: of doctors in Spain are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Spain authorises temporary hiring of new farm workers
text: Spain has authorised temporarily hiring thousands of migrants and jobless people to address agricultural labour shortages. The unemployed will receive state benefits as well as their wages.

title: Asylum seekers in Dutch village disinfect grocery carts to protect population
text: In Ter Apel, a village in the Netherlands, asylum seekers have volunteered to disinfect grocery carts, walkers, and keys to protect fellow citizens from COVID-19 at a local supermarket.
quote-text: ‘As refugees, the least we can do is to help the Dutch people as they have done everything toward us at Camp Ter Apel’.

title: UK farms call to bring migrant agricultural workers to work
text: 150 fruit and vegetable pickers from Romania arrived at Stansted Airport in April to work on UK farms. Large farms have warned that fruit and vegetables would ‘run out’ if the UK government failed to provide seasonal migrants in the agricultural sector as the country had entered ‘an unprecedented time’.
stats-comment: of employees in food manufacturing in the UK are migrants (IPPR, 2019)

title: UK refugees, asylum seekers, and migrants deliver food parcels
text: Volunteers deliver food parcels to refugees and asylum seekers deliver food parcels to local residents without support networks, through the charity Bearwood Action for Refugees (BAFR).
quote-text: ‘I found BAFR as a place of comfort for me and my four kids... With the food delivery I was able to put food on the table for my kids, now we do not lack anything.’
quote-author: Recipient of a BAFR food parcel

title: UK automatically renews visas for all foreign NHS workers
text: UK NHS migrant doctors, nurses, paramedics and their families have had their work visas automatically extended for a year free of charge. Restrictions on the amount of hours student nurses and doctors are allowed to work have also been lifted.
quote-text: ‘We owe them a great deal of gratitude for all that they do.’
stats-comment: of NHS healthcare workers are foreign-born (ONS, 2018)

title: UK MPs campaign for indefinite leave to remain for foreign nationals in the NHS
text: Several MPs have been campaigning for foreign nationals working in the NHS to gain the right to remain indefinitely.
quote-text: ‘Those who have put their lives at risk for our country are welcome to live in it’.
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the NHS are foreign-born (ONS, 2018)

title: UK suspends reporting, registration restrictions, and resettlement for asylum seekers
text: The UK government has suspended and cancelled all registration, reporting, and resettlement requirements for asylum seekers, and put all voluntary returns, evictions, and statelessness applications on hold. 350 people in detention have also been released during the pandemic, with an urgent call for all detention cases to be reviewed.
stats-comment: applied for asylum in the UK in 2018 (OECD, 2016)

title: UK public calls to fast-track registration of migrant doctors
text: The UK government is being pressured by the public and MPs to fast-track the registration of qualified doctors from overseas into the NHS.
quote-text: ‘Our heroic NHS doctors are stretched to breaking point. At the same time there are hundreds of overseas-qualified doctors, many of whom arrived in the UK as refugees, that right now are not permitted to practice.’
stats-comment: of doctors in the NHS are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Wallonia translates COVID-19 information for migrants
text: SetisW, a Wallonian social interpretation service, is translating essential information on COVID-19 into 14 languages. This service helps migrant key workers and newcomers to Belgium to access and understand official safety advice on COVID-19.
stats-comment: of key workers in Belgium are migrants (Joint Research Centre, 2020)

title: Buenos Aires, Argentina allows migrant doctors to practice
text: In Buenos Aires, Venezuelan doctors have had their requalification licenses fast-tracked to work in local hospitals. It was thought that this would allow over 1,000 already-qualified doctors to begin practicing.
quote-text: ‘Venezuelan doctors are willing to work with courage, vocation, and will’.
quote-author: Head of Civil Association of Venezuelan Doctors Indira Acosta Cedeno

title: Chile suspends requalification requirement for migrant doctors
text: Chile has suspended their requirement for migrant doctors to requalify in an effort to equip their healthcare system for ‘caseloads on a European scale’.

title: Colombian NGO provides mental health support for migrants
text: In Colombia, a non-profit run by Venezuelan migrants has begun providing support and advice to migrants affected by the COVID-19 outbreak, recognising the emotional and physical strain placed on many people and communities.
stats-comment: 1,400,000 Venezuelans  were living in Colombia in 2019 (United Nations)

title: Colombia allows Venezuelan migrant workers to access healthcare
text: Colombia has allowed Venezuelan migrants to access healthcare during the COVID-19 crisis. The country vowed to continue its attention to the vulnerable migrant population and ensure they were prioritised for access to essential services and can fulfill their basic needs.
stats-comment: 1,400,000 Venezuelans were living in Colombia in 2019 (United Nations)

title: Cuba sends doctors to Italy
text: Cuban doctors have been sent to Italy to  help fight COVID-19 in one of the worst affected areas of the country, Lombardy.
quote-text: ‘Of course I’m scared, but I was scared when we went to Africa to cure Ebola in 2014, but we fulfilled our mission and came back’.
quote-author: Cuban doctor Leonardo Fernandez in Lombardy

title: Peru recruits foreign health professionals
text: The Peruvian government has called for foreign doctors and nurses to help their country in the fight against COVID-19.
stats-comment: In 2018, Peru faced a deficit of almost 17,000 medical specialists (Peruvian Ministry of Health)

title: British Columbia registers international medical graduates as associate physicians
text: The College of Physicians and Surgeons in British Columbia has licensed thousands of international medical graduates as associate physicians in efforts to combat COVID-19.
stats-comment: of Canadian doctors are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)
source: College of Physicians and Surgeons of British Columbia

title: California announces financial support for irregular migrants
text: California is the first US state to give cash stimulus payments to undocumented immigrants.. The state will offer $500 to 150,000 adults left out of the $2.2 trillion stimulus package approved by Congress.
quote-text: ‘We feel a deep sense of gratitude for people that are in fear of deportations that are still addressing essential needs of tens of millions of Californians’.
stats-comment: of California’s workforce are illegal immigrants. In 2019, they paid more than $2.5 billion in state and local taxes (TIME, 2020)

title: Canadian healthcare sector calls for access to healthcare for new migrants
text: Canadian doctors, nurses and activists are calling on provincial governments to give immediate access to free healthcare for all newcomers during the COVID-19 pandemic.Typically, new arrivals in Canada have to wait at least three months to access provincial health coverage.
stats-comment: One million immigrants are projected to enter Canada between 2018-2020 (Canadian House of Commons, 2017)

title: Canada exempts temporary migrant workers from travel restrictions
text: Canadian MPs have allowed exemptions to the international travel ban by enabling temporary migrant workers to travel to Canada to work in the seafood and agri-food sectors.
quote-text: ‘At least 30% of the workforce is temporary foreign workers’.
stats-comment: travel to Canada as temporary foreign workers each year (CBC, 2020)

title: Jamaican seasonal workers to sign waivers releasing the government from liability for costs due to exposure to COVID-19
text: In Canada, migrant workers felt that they had ‘no choice but to sign’ waivers releasing the Jamacian government from liability for costs, damages, and losses caused by exposure to COVID-19.
stats-comment: People travel to Canada as temporary foreign workers each year (CBC, 2020)

title: Canada supports employers’ quarantine measures for workers
text: Canadian government gave employers $1500 per worker to help with quarantine measures, acknowledging that the labour shortage depends on foreign temporary workers.The Canadian government has provided $50 million to food and agriculture employers to cover quarantine needs for migrant workers, with employers receiving $1500 per worker.
stats-comment: People travel to Canada as temporary foreign workers each year (CBC, 2020)

title: Massachusetts allows foreign doctors to practice medicine
text: Massachusetts has allowed migrant doctors, nurses, and students to practice medicine in an effort to staff two 1250-bed convention field hospitals.
quote-text: ‘These orders will contribute to our efforts to grow a robust community of front-line workers to support our health care institutions’,
stats-comment: of doctors in the USA are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Nevada waives licensing requirements for medical workers
text: Nevada has waived all licensing requirements for healthcare professionals and administrators. The state has called on those currently unable to practice due to restrictions to join the state-wide battle against COVID-19.
quote-text: ‘This is our moment to once again show the world what it means to be Battle Born’.
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2016)

title: New Jersey lifts restrictions for foreign-qualified doctors
text: In New Jersey restrictions on healthcare professionals have been lifted, enabling recently retired physicians to help with the COVID-19 response and granting temporary licenses to those who have qualified in other countries.
stats-comment: of doctors in the USA are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: New York allows foreign-qualified health workers to work
text: New York state is allowing healthcare professionals who have qualified outside the US to take part in the COVID-19 response, and is encouraging their registration. New York has also automatically licensed all foreign students who have not yet completed their studies in the US.
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2015)

title: USA classifies agricultural and healthcare workers as ‘essential workers’
text: The US Department of Homeland Security has officially categorised ‘essential workers’, including those in the agriculture, medical and healthcare, and construction industries. Government advice emphasises that these industries are needed to ensure infrastructure resilience and should be considered when implementing state-level COVID-19 restrictions.
stats-comment: of agricultural workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2018)

title: USA recruits medical professionals on work or exchange visas
text: The USA has continued to provide emergency visas to medical professionals on a work or exchange visa programme. All migrant medics already residents in the US have had their programmes and visa conditions extended to help the country-wide COVID-19 response.
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2015)

title: US states petition to allow migrants access to healthcare
text: The states of New York, Connecticut, and Vermont have petitioned the US Supreme Court to allow migrants access to healthcare during the COVID-19 pandemic. The petitions calls to block a regulation penalising immigrants for seeking access to healthcare and social assistance.
quote-text: ‘The regulation impedes efforts to stop the spread of the coronavirus, preserve scarce hospital capacity, and protect the lives of everyone in our communities—citizens and noncitizens alike’.
source: Department of Education, Skills and Employment Australia

title: India considering portable benefits for migrants
text: India is considering World Bank funding for state-government support to internal migrants irrespective of their state of residence. This fund would also increase access to benefits that is portable across state boundaries.

title: Italy considering regularizing migrants
text: Italian ministers have drafted a law allowing for the regularization of migrants 'in order to make up for the shortage of workers in the agriculture, livestock, fishing and aquaculture sectors'. Under this proposed legislation, irregular migrants would be allowed a residence permit along with a 'no more than one year' contract subject to renewal.
quote-text: In the emergency phase, I believe it is essential to regularize non-EU citizens who receive job offers ... either it is the State that takes charge of the lives of these people or crime will exploit it.'
quote-author: Italian Minister of Agriculture Teresa Bellanova
